donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: Malaria has historically been a major public health problem in São Tomé & Príncipe (STP), once accounting for 68% of hospitalizations and 48% of hospital deaths in the country (DHS, 2009).Morbidity and mortality related to malaria have been reduced in STP as a result of the integrated antimalarial efforts.The malaria burden in STP has reduced significantly, accounting for 18% of hospitalizations and 5% of hospital deaths in 2009 (DHS). The Program aims to consolidate efforts to reduce the malaria burden in STP through the continuation of current antimalaria efforts and further institutional strengthening, followed by intensified surveillance and diversified interventions, and finally leading to the elimination of malaria transmission in STP.

project_descr: CONSOLIDATING EFFORTS TOWARDS MALARIA ELIMINATION IN SAO TOMÉ AND PRINCIPE
